intro: Vittadinia dissecta, commonly known as the dissected vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a feathery appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. Vittadinia dissecta produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
